is a small Medieval town near located in between

. The town is totally surrounded by the walls which slope down from it majestic Castle, a typical medieval military edifice erected in the High Middle Ages, probably on the former site of a Roman fort. Soave’s Castle is probably one of the most well-preserved buildings of its époque and, once insight, visitors really have the feeling that the age of seigneurs, lords and duels was never over.

But the Caste is just part of Soave’s monuments and heritage sites. Take a look at the Palace of Justice, the Scaliger Palace, near Porta Aquila, or at the Church of Santa Maria dei Domenicani.
The town is also worldwide famous for the typical dry white wine – Soave – which is produced in the romantic hills surrounding the Medieval walls. A dedicated festival is organised in May in order to celebrate the virtues of this very popular wine.
The nearest railway station is San Bonifacio (5km south-east – 10min by bus), which has direct connections with Verona,
Three international airports are conveniently located nearby:

value: Verona Valerio Catullo (VRN) [7], 36km, many domestic flights and some international destinations (also low-cost) (
) by train: bus to Verona Porta Nuova station, then bus or train to San Bonifacio, then bus
Venezia Marco Polo (VCE) [2], 103km, lot of destinations throughout Europe (
) by train: bus to Venezia Mestre station, then train to San Bonifacio or Verona, then bus
Treviso (TSF) [5], 113km, low-cost airport with Ryanair and other carriers (
) by train: bus to Treviso station, then train to San Bonifacio or Verona, then bus

Soave is just 20km east of Verona and can easily be reached through the A4 Milan-Venice highway (Soave is 20 km east from Verona, it is easily reachable taking the A4 highway (Soave-San Bonifacio exit).
) directly connects Soave to Verona (45min) and to San Bonifacio train station (10min).
